name: NSAccessibilityProtocol
desc: The complete list of properties and methods implemented by accessible elements.

items.name: accessibilityString
items.desc: Returns the substring for the specified range.

items.name: accessibilityAttributedString
items.desc: Returns the attributed substring for the specified range of characters.

items.name: accessibilityRTF
items.desc: Returns the Rich Text Format (RTF) data that describes the specified range of characters.

items.name: accessibilityFrame
items.desc: Returns the rectangle enclosing the specified range of characters.

items.name: accessibilityLine
items.desc: Returns the line number for the line holding the specified character index.

items.name: accessibilityRange
items.desc: Returns the range of characters for the glyph that includes the specified character.

items.name: accessibilityStyleRange
items.desc: Returns a range of characters that all have the same style as the specified character.

items.name: accessibilityRange
items.desc: Returns the range of characters in the specified line.

items.name: accessibilityRange
items.desc: Returns the range of characters for the glyph at the specified point.

items.name: NSAccessibilitySortDirection
items.desc: Values that indicate the sort direction of a column.

items.name: accessibilityCell
items.desc: The cell at the specified column and row.

items.name: accessibilityLayoutPoint
items.desc: Converts the provided point in screen coordinates to a point in the layout area’s coordinate system.

items.name: accessibilityLayoutSize
items.desc: Converts the provided size in screen coordinates to a size in the layout area’s coordinate system.

items.name: accessibilityScreenPoint
items.desc: Converts the provided point in the layout area’s coordinates to a point in the screen’s coordinate system.

items.name: accessibilityScreenSize
items.desc: Converts the provided size in the layout area’s coordinates to a size in the screen’s coordinate system.

items.name: NSAccessibilityRulerMarkerType
items.desc: Values that indicate the marker type of an element.

items.name: NSAccessibilityUnits
items.desc: Values that indicate the unit values of a ruler or layout area.

items.name: accessibilityPerformCancel
items.desc: Cancels the current operation.

items.name: accessibilityPerformConfirm
items.desc: Simulates pressing Return in the element.

items.name: accessibilityPerformDecrement
items.desc: Decrements the element’s value.

items.name: accessibilityPerformDelete
items.desc: Deletes the element’s value.

items.name: accessibilityPerformIncrement
items.desc: Increments the element’s value.

items.name: accessibilityPerformPick
items.desc: Selects the element.

items.name: accessibilityPerformPress
items.desc: Simulates clicking the element.

items.name: accessibilityPerformRaise
items.desc: Brings this window to the front.

items.name: accessibilityPerformShowAlternateUI
items.desc: Displays the element’s alternate UI.

items.name: accessibilityPerformShowDefaultUI
items.desc: Returns to the element’s original UI.

items.name: accessibilityPerformShowMenu
items.desc: Displays this menu element.

items.name: isAccessibilitySelectorAllowed
items.desc: Indicates whether the provided selector can be invoked on the element.

items.name: uiElements
items.desc: An array of elements that are associated with the notification.

items.name: announcement
items.desc: The announcement, as a localized string.

items.name: priority
items.desc: A priority level that can help an assistive app determine how to handle the corresponding notification.

items.name: NSAccessibilityPriorityLevel
items.desc: A data type for notification priority levels.

items.name: NSAccessibilityOrientation
items.desc: Values that indicate the orientation of elements, such as scroll bars and split views.

items.name: ocol NSAccessibilityContainsTransientUI
items.desc: A set of methods that support accessibility in a UI that changes dynamically—usually in response to mouse-hover events.
